components.description:
A gesture showing the index finger and thumb touching to make an open circle. Represents “I’m okay” or “yes, that’s correct / good”.

In American Sign Language (ASL), the number nine is represented with this gesture. The same hand sign can be seen as offensive in some cultures, including in parts of Europe, the Middle East, and South America.

This can also be used as a symbol of White Supremacy, depending on context.
components.title: OK Hand Sign

description:

In American Sign Language (ASL), the number nine is represented with this gesture. The same hand sign can be seen as offensive in some cultures, including in parts of Europe, the Middle East, and South America.

This can also be used as a symbol of White Supremacy, depending on context.
title: OK Hand Sign

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

bn:00096817a: Being satisfactory or in satisfactory condition

bn:00096926a: Inspiring awe or admiration or wonder- Melville
Causing astonishment in; causing to be astonished.

bn:00083081v: To take part in a sexual act.
To take part in sexual activity (most commonly sexual intercourse) with another person for the purposes of sexual pleasure.
To have sexual intercourse, to copulate.
To take part in sexual intercourse.
To have sex, sexual relations with someone

bn:01488980n: An A-ok is both a saying, derived from okay, and a hand-gesture done by connecting the thumb and index finger into a circle, and holding the other fingers straight or relaxed in the air.

bn:00042759n: That part of the fore limb below the forearm or wrist in primates (including humans).
The part of the fore limb below the forearm or wrist in a human, and the corresponding part in many other animals.
The zoological term for the distal portion of the forelimb of an animal (including the human hand)
The (prehensile) extremity of the superior limb
The manus is the zoological term for the distal portion of the fore limb of an animal.
A hand, as the part of the fore limb below the forearm in a man, or the corresponding part in other vertebrates.
A hand is a prehensile, multi-fingered extremity located at the end of an arm or forelimb of primates such as humans, chimpanzees, monkeys, and lemurs.

bn:01634840n: The Bloods are a primarily, though not exclusively, African American street gang founded in Los Angeles, California.
Street gang founded in Los Angeles, California
A street gang founded in Los Angeles, California

bn:00058395n: "OK" is a word denoting approval, acceptance, agreement, assent, or acknowledgment.

bn:00006453n: Fuck is an English-language word, a profane word which refers to the act of sexual intercourse and is also commonly used to denote disdain or as an intensifier.
An act of sexual intercourse, especially one lacking passion or a feeling of sincere love.
Sexual intercourse; the act of screwing.

bn:00044407n: An opening into or through something

apple_vendor_description: The OK Hand emoji on Apple devices is rendered with a clean, crisp white palm and a perfectly formed thumb and index finger meeting to create a precise circle. Its smooth, 3D shading gives it a polished, almost tangible feel, embodying a sense of approval, agreement, or well-being. This emoji from Apple's collection is universally understood to signify that everything is alright, good to go, or excellent.
